page.title: 06BOOTHOUSE FARM, RUSHTON.
page.content: { Boothouse Farm}is a dairy farm with 125 milking cows and 57 calves. The Farm has 131 acres which is divided into 13 fields.{Mr. and Mrs. Parton are part tenants and part owners of the farm with{Sir John Egerton.}Mr. and Mrs. Parton said that the farm used to be called 'Booth Hurst' but 100 years ago this was changed to 'Boothouse'. There has been a farm on this site since 1416 and there may be some parts still standing, but the farmhouse was knocked down 100 years ago and another was built in its place.The Farm has a lot of machinery, which includes three tractors,to help with the work. Mr. and Mrs. Parton go to{Beeston {Cattle Market}once a month to buy and sell cattle. Their{Milk Quota}is 700,000 litres per year.
